title: JamesBorn
author: JamesBorn
content: Somebody offer me a good paying job that can sustain my financial needs! But there are conditions attached to it, like if I accept that job I will not be continuing in this forum or have time to trade, invest and mining bitcoin. There is restrictions of cell phone to use at your work place, and I don't want to leave bitcoin.If the job finally succeeds, do you think I should go for it or face my bitcoin business? I have not really gain much in bitcoin but I believe the project and with time I must've grown better in crypto system.

comments.author: IIrik11
comments.body: take the job!u'll have plenty of time in time to do both.new job takes time to adapt to in first few months but soon..u'll be able to juggle both without any problems.but do not lose this opportunity.i regret some of the decisions i took in my life and..one of them was quitting a really good paying job.

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Forum is not a job, and taking a job will not stop you from investing in bitcoins. As a matter of fact because you already have knowledge of bitcoin, the money you have been paid from the job can be channeled into investing more in bitcoins why you still have and keep some little percentage to be comfortable while you keep the bitcoins that you've purchased. You must not be in the forum to own bitcoins, there are people who do not know about this forum but have bitcoins, yours becomes an Extra advantage, you have capital to invest, and you know this forum and what you get from here, information wise.

comments.author: WillyAp
comments.body: Well take it, and do Bitcoin on the side. Never put all eggs into on basket.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Quote from: WillyAp on April 14, 2023, 08:12:30 PMWell take it, and do Bitcoin on the side. Never put all eggs into on basket.Good advice here.Never limit your options by committing & going all in on one option. Get the guaranteed job, steady income & work on, buy & save bitcoin in your spare time. You can definitely make time for both, the forum isn't important but you can definitely make time to study bitcoin & buy some when you are not working hard in your regular job.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: I'd gladly take the job. While I won't be active in the forum or other crypto-related activities, I believe I can still allocate some money to buy/DCA regularly. At the end of the day being active in the forum or trading is also a way for you to get Bitcoin. You might not spend your money but you definitely trade your time for it. I've been doing a similar thing in the past months, and although it doesn't last that long since I work on a temporary job, I still buy Bitcoin regularly when I did that. In short, it doesn't really affect the way you obtain Bitcoin, it might even help you if your new job allows you to dump $1k regularly into crypto while having a good life.

I have not really gain much in bitcoin but I believe the project and with time I must've grown better in crypto system.It's ultimately up to you to decide what's best for your financial situation and future goals. However, it's important to weigh the potential benefits and drawbacks of the job offer and how it aligns with your long-term aspirations. Consider the potential career growth, stability, and financial security that the job could offer versus the time and opportunity cost of stepping away from your bitcoin endeavors. It's also worth exploring if there are any compromises or alternatives that could allow you to pursue both options. Be wise.

comments.author: rybako
comments.body: I think you should consider the pros and cons of both options carefully. Bitcoin is a great project and has a lot of potential, but it is also very volatile and risky. You never know when the price will go up or down, or when the market will crash or boom. You also need to have enough knowledge, skills, and resources to trade, invest, and mine Bitcoin successfully. If you rely solely on Bitcoin for your income, you may face a lot of uncertainty and stress.On the other hand, a good-paying job can provide you with a stable and secure income, as well as other benefits such as health insurance, retirement plan, etc. You can also use some of your earnings to buy and hold Bitcoin for the long term, without having to worry about short-term fluctuations. You can also learn more about Bitcoin and the crypto system in your spare time, and maybe find ways to integrate it with your job or career.Of course, you should also consider your passion, interest, and goals in life. If you really love Bitcoin and want to dedicate your time and energy to it, then maybe you should stick with it. But if you are not sure or confident about it, then maybe you should take the job offer. Ultimately, the choice is yours, but I think you should always have a backup for income because of Bitcoin’s volatility. You don’t want to put all your eggs in one basket and regret it later.

comments.author: wallet4bitcoin

You are not going to be working for 24 hours so the rest of the day after work gives you ample time to handle whatever business you have running digitally and that includes trading because Bitcoin is unlike Forex, it has no closure time and resumption time as brokers do. Take up the job so you can have more money to invest in Bitcoin but ensure to also keep track of the Bitcoin space as one week out of it looks like 1 year without updating a software due for weekly updates.
